result.execSummary:
All charges against Matthew J White in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew J White is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J White

defendant.name: White, Matthew J
defendant.address: N58 W23777 Hastings Ct #19, Sussex, WI 53089

records.addlTxt:
01:01 PM Attorney Brandon Carleton for attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court.   Defendant Matthew J White did not appear.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
The Court notes that it receive notice that the Defendant was in an accident on the way to court and is now deceased.
ADA Will moves to dismiss the case.
The Court dismisses the case.
The Court give the family its condolences.

10:54 AM Attorney Brandon Carlson for attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court.   Defendant Matthew J White did not appear.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Carlson states he and his parents have tired to contact the Defendant, however no success. 
State motions the Court to issue a warrant for the defendant and to revoke and forfeit any bail.
Attorney Carlson requests a stayed warrant.
The Court will issue a warrant and forfeit bail.
EXT CODE 2.

Adjustment Number: 22A 020576,
Payable Number: 465691,
Receipt Number: 22R 022204,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring and drug testing through WCS.  CAM duration and drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and drug testing.   Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

03:50 PM Defendant Matthew J White in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
